1.text: And the Lord continued, and he said to Job:

2.text: Will he who contends with God be so easily silenced? Certainly, he who argues with God must also respond to him.

3.text: Then Job answered the Lord, saying:

4.text: What could I possibly answer, since I have been speaking thoughtlessly? I will place my hand over my mouth.

5.text: One thing I have spoken, which I wish I had not said; and another, to which I will add no more.

6.text: But the Lord, answering Job out of the whirlwind, said:

7.text: Gird your waist like a man. I will question you, and you must answer me.

8.text: Will you make my judgment null and void; and will you condemn me so that you may be justified?

9.text: And do you have an arm like God, or a voice like thunder?

10.text: Envelop yourself with splendor, and raise yourself up on high, and be glorious, and put on splendid garments.

11.text: Scatter the arrogant with your wrath, and, when you see all the arrogant, humble them.

12.text: Look down upon each of the arrogant and confound them, and crush the impious in their place.

13.text: Hide them in the dust together and plunge their faces into the pit.

14.text: Then I will confess that your right hand is able to save you.

15.text: Behold, the behemoth, whom I created along with you, eats hay like an ox.

16.text: His strength is in his lower back, and his power is in the center of his abdomen.

17.text: He draws up his tail like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs have been drawn together.

18.text: His bones are like pipes of brass; his cartilage is like plates of iron.

19.text: He is the beginning of the ways of God, who made him; he will use him as his sword.

20.text: The mountains bring forth grass for him; all the beasts of the field will play there.

21.text: He sleeps in the shadows, under the cover of branches, and in moist places.

22.text: The shadows cover his shadow; the willows of the brook will encircle him.

23.text: Behold, he will drink a river and not be amazed, and he has confidence that the Jordan could flow into his mouth.

24.text: He will seize him through his eyes, as if with a hook, and he will bore through his nostrils, as if with stakes.
